sentences.english: She brought me a bottle of home made fermented brown rice.
sentences.chinese: 她给我一瓶自制糙米甜酒酿。

sentences.english: However, brown rice does not last as long as white rice because of the oil-rich layer of bran.
sentences.chinese: 然而由于富油的麸皮，糙米保存时间不像精米那么长。

sentences.english: Highlanders Brown Rice Tea can be consumed regularly without any side effects.
sentences.chinese: 高地糙米茶可以经常食用无任何副作用。

sentences.english: Thede-non starch lipid can improve the storage stability of the brown rice.
sentences.chinese: 脱去非淀粉脂能改善糙米储藏稳定性。

sentences.english: The production process of brown rice germination and brown rice bud brewing had been studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了糙米发芽和糙米芽低醇饮料酒的酿造工艺。

sentences.english: The production process of brown rice germination and brown rice bud brewing had been studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了糙米发芽和糙米芽低醇饮料酒的酿造工艺。

sentences.english: The brown rice thickness was significantly positively correlated with taste value at 1% probability level.
sentences.chinese: 糙米粒厚与米饭食味评分呈极显著正相关。

sentences.english: Its mouthfeel was much better than the red rice wine fermented with red rice alone.
sentences.chinese: 并且在口感上大大优于纯红糙米发酵生成的纯红米酿。

sentences.english: But As concentration of brown rice has most positively correlation to that of culm.
sentences.chinese: 穗茎节砷含量与糙米砷含量之间呈极显著正相关。

sentences.english: Eat oatmeal at breakfast, choose whole-wheat bread at lunch, or whip up brown rice at dinner instead of white.
sentences.chinese: 早餐燕麦片，中午全麦面包，晚饭再把精米换成糙米。

sentences.english: Have a bowl of sweetened brown rice.
Then I tried short grain brown rice.
sentences.chinese: 随后我又试了短粒糙米。

sentences.english: Many food studies simply lump brown and white rice together.
sentences.chinese: 很多食品研究都直接归于糙米和精米的比较。

sentences.english: Although rich in nutrition, brown rice is not palatable for direct eating.
sentences.chinese: 糙米营养丰富，直接炊煮食用有许多弊端。

sentences.english: The results provide for the promotion and application of the moisture conditioning technology.
sentences.chinese: 研究结果为糙米加湿调质技术的推广应用提供参考。

definition: semipolished rice (i.e. rice minus the husk, but including the germ)
grain crops other than rice and wheat
grains of Job's tears plant 薏苡[yi4 yi3]
